summary: Internal Deutsche Bank emails from February 2015 discussing AML/KYC alerts related to a beneficiary of the 'Butterfly Trust' established by Jeffrey Epstein. The alerts pertain to a 2008 lawsuit alleging sexual abuse by Epstein, which was dropped, and a racketeering lawsuit. Compliance confirms the beneficiary was cleared of all charges and is only a beneficiary with no account authority.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank's AML Compliance was reviewing alerts in 2015 related to a beneficiary of Jeffrey Epstein's 'Butterfly Trust'.
The alerts pertained to a 2008 lawsuit alleging Epstein sexually abused underage girls (which was dropped) and a racketeering lawsuit.
The bank had previously cleared the beneficiary in December 2013, confirming the individual was only a beneficiary with no authority over the trust account.
The correspondence confirms Epstein was the grantor of the Butterfly Trust and had previously pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution.
The document shows internal bank processes for handling high-risk clients and the re-review of historical legal issues during KYC updates.
